body_html: Should be whenever the next push is. In the meantime, the fix is just to add super(DropoutWrapper, self).__init__() as the first line of DropoutWrapper's __init__. Once it syncs, the change will add that to a few other wrappers and add some unit tests.
body_text: Should be whenever the next push is. In the meantime, the fix is just to add super(DropoutWrapper, self).__init__() as the first line of DropoutWrapper's __init__. Once it syncs, the change will add that to a few other wrappers and add some unit tests.
body: Should be whenever the next push is. In the meantime, the fix is just to add `super(DropoutWrapper, self).__init__()` as the [first line of `DropoutWrapper`'s `__init__`](https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/a9761960e282cdcf0822951dec86372181f0e88e/tensorflow/python/ops/rnn_cell_impl.py#L981). Once it syncs, the change will add that to a few other wrappers and add some unit tests.
